title: Paper Chase:  Pam Moon Suggests Lucas Cranach the Elder Painted the Lier Copy
post:
interesting piece, although I think Pam at times overindulges in seeing “similarities” between the paintings and the Shroud.
Interesting that although the Lier Shroud is generally very accurate in its depiction, it doesn’t show things like the blood marks on the forearms, head, and small of the back. Were all of these “add ons” sometime after 1516? One would think that the Lier Shroud would have depicted them if they existed on the shroud at the time the Lier Shroud was painted.
author: Thomas
